programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Behind-the-Scenes of a Hit Tour
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan take you backstage and give a unique view of their winter tour in New Hampshire. See what it takes to make their show a smashing success!

programme.title: FIXT
programme.sub-title: FIXT: Real Estate Agent Ready To Invest In His Teeth
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Vanishing of a Promising Wisconsin Teen
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Power of One
programme.desc: News 8 is following the journey of a young York County woman with a stage 4 terminal cancer diagnosis as part of our series, "Power of One".

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It!: Deep Dish Teacher Squares Off Against Lawyer Turned Pasta-Preneur
programme.desc: Former teacher Craig Falk is hitting the (cook)books against former lawyer Laurie Boucher. Which of these second-career chefs best showcases their culinary skills to craft the perfect packed lunch?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Oklahoma Girl Scout Murders
programme.desc: As Girl Scouts at Camp Scott settle into their tents one evening, eerie footsteps and distant cries haunt the campers throughout the night. The unsettling sounds turn out to be the echos one of the largest murder investigations in Oklahoma's history.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: On two blind dates in Orlando, local couples cozy up over bird watching, spy friendly gators, sample decadent desserts, and get loose on game night.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teen murdered but no suspects. A woman allegedly killed by a panhandler

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the 'Burgh: Nailing It In Carnegie
programme.desc: Ed and Day get competitive over a round of golf and learn a new twist on old fashion cocktail making before heading to Apis Meadery in Carnegie.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.sub-title: Boston Rob Does Beantown: Chinatown Treats
programme.desc: Rob feasts on fabulous cuisine, makes more than a few new friends and joins a trampoline gym class in one of Boston's oldest neighborhoods.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Kansas City Gives Classic Cocktails a Spirited Twist
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Dream, believe, and take action. Kids can achieve all that they desire. Across the country, kids demonstrate there is no limit to what they can accomplish when they believe in themselves and put in the work to make their dreams come true.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Renowned singer Vicente Griego takes Amanda on a cultural journey steeped in tradition—from learning the basics of flamenco dance to watching how custom guitars are crafted at a family-run workshop.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Make Way for Morgantown, WV
programme.desc: Go on a kayak adventure, grab some unique eats, and zipline your heart out on a trip to this happening city on the Monongahela river.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Grab your picnic basket! Chef Ravin Patel and Chef Salvador Gutierrez are about to go head-to-head, attempting to serve up the perfect picnic dishes in the “City of Trees.”

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Crime Fighter in Plane Sight
programme.desc: While dedicating her time to criminal justice reform, Erinn placed connecting with nature on the back burner. She’s a free spirit who travels the world and jumps out of planes but doesn’t know what Kentucky has to offer – it's time to change that.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: The Oddest Cases of Family on the Wrong Side of the Law
programme.desc: Siblings stealing money from a Girl Scout? A father-daughter burglary ring? In these unusual cases, family members find themselves in hot water with the justice system.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.sub-title: Wait, What Happened?: Paging Pet Detectives
programme.desc: Odd grasshoppers, unusual animal mating and buggy beer… Host Frank Nicotero has these questions and more for some Cincinnati locals – with cash on the line.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project
programme.desc: Join WGAL News 8's Anne Shannon for "Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project," where we relive the best of 2024 through the eyes of our award-winning photojournalists.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This year, we're marking ten seasons as a show. Our goal has been to highlight you, Americans from across the country. Stories that mirrored our shared challenges are perseverance, ingenuity and compassion. Today, we take a look at some of those.

programme.title: Escaping The Blade
programme.desc: Why California's sex traffickers are walking free while victims wait in fear and how organizations are fighting to protect survivors.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Power of One
programme.desc: News 8 is following the journey of a young York County woman with a stage 4 terminal cancer diagnosis as part of our series, "Power of One".

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.sub-title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption
programme.desc: (2019) Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption focuses on people who were sentenced to life in prison as juveniles. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro examines how these these former offenders are re-entering society and the reaction from victims' families.

programme.title: Pulse: Orlando Still Strong
programme.desc: Two journalists describe the lasting impact of the Pulse nightclub shooting.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Fried and Tried Midwest Foods to Excite Your Palate
programme.desc: Dive into the Midwest's fried delights. From Friday night fish fries to tasty testicles and fried grilled cheese? Enjoy the area's most iconic and delectable crispy fried goodness.
